name: places/ChIJUb5kVYhZwokRP5DHegKhqmI
formattedAddress: 8 Centre Market Pl, New York, NY 10013, USA
adrFormatAddress: 8 Centre Market Pl, New York, NY 10013-3233, USA

editorialSummary.text: On a Little Italy side street, this shop offers goods from European designers plus its own clogs.

originalText.text: I finally got my boots!  I saw these on a gal on a plane probably a year ago.  She said they were the No 6 crepe sole booties and I fell in love and became obsessed to get these.  I messaged them on Instagram.  I stopped into the store a couple of times when in Soho.  I kept watching the website.  I tried to be patient.  Then one day, I saw them on their site and they said, coming soon.  I had to drop my email to get notified.  I was close...finally, I received an email saying I could order, I did and boom!  I now own the most fantastic pair of black rocker chic yet classic crepe sole badass boots and I am thrilled!  It's the longest I've waited for something and it was worth it!  I highly recommend these.  I put them on and immediately fell in love!!!!!

originalText.text: I did not buy my No 6 chocolate brown mid heel shearling clogs here but I was inspired by today's frigid temps to write a rave review about them. I bought them at a boutique in Brooklyn many years ago (maybe 2017ish) and they keep my feet SO WARM. I can walk around in them for miles and miles as I do almost every day of the winter. Highly recommend!

originalText.text: Wow. I am so grateful and excited to share my review. I will start off my saying that many years ago, a friend of mine in acting school told me about No 6 clogs. She had a pair, and I was obsessed, and she told me her No 6 clogs were literally the most comfortable thing ever and so I knew I wanted to try to grab a pair but unfortunately, the boots were a bit too narrow for my left foot, because I had broken my foot in the past and it never healed back to normal. As you can imagine, I was really sad. So for a while, I just figured I would never wear their shoes. I kept seeing them and wanted them, so I eventually ordered a pair from Farfetch, but alas, I had to return them because once again they were too narrow. I went to the sample sale this summer, ok I am realizing this is literally turning into my life story but I also want to share everything I can so I'm just gonna keep going, anyway, I went to the sample sale this summer, tried on boots, and they were too tight on my left foot. I was so sad. I am such a picky person and when I like something, I love it. Then this winter, they were having a sale, and so I for some reason reached out on instagram and asked if they had this one pair of mule platforms (open toes) that I had literally been eyeing for like 2 years. Maybe 3. Bianca sent them to the store for me. I got in to the store a month and a half later, and they were still there for me!!!! I tried them on, and I kid you not, they were the most comfortable thing ever, felt like I was walking on air. I bought them on the spot, and I just reached out to Bianca to send another pair of a different shoe to the store, and will be going in to the store tomorrow to try them on. I am so impressed with Bianca, how kind and helpful she has been for me! She has made me feel like a cared for customer, and I appreciate that she has gone above and beyond to try and help me with literally all my questions, and sending the shoes to the store on my behalf. Such incredible customer service. Thank you so much! I know now that certain shoes will or won't work for me but it's worth trying if I like something and I know I will always be treated well and looked out for! And I freakin looooooooove my adorable sexy shoes!!!!!!

originalText.text:
I have seven pairs of No. 6 clogs that I have bought through both the online shop and at a local boutique in my hometown. Yes, sizing is often difficult (unless you have narrow feet), but I have always loved their quality and variety.

On a recent NYC trip, I was so looking forward to visiting No 6 in person for the first time and buying directly from the shop. Unfortunately, it was just an unpleasant, awkward, and disappointing experience. In a near empty store (two staff, me, and one other shopper), I wasn’t acknowledged. I felt very unwelcome.

And so ends my devotion to No 6 clogs.

On a recent NYC trip, I was so looking forward to visiting No 6 in person for the first time and buying directly from the shop. Unfortunately, it was just an unpleasant, awkward, and disappointing experience. In a near empty store (two staff, me, and one other shopper), I wasn’t acknowledged. I felt very unwelcome.

And so ends my devotion to No 6 clogs.

originalText.text: I love this shop so much it hurts! The clogs and boots are, by all accounts, amazing (I currently own 4 pairs). But the shop itself is just so well-curated—I love visiting and browsing through the minimal (yet very well-chosen) racks of clothing. It’s quite obvious that a great deal of thought goes into the purchasing of each special piece of clothing. And it’s rare that I’m able to find multiple pieces of clothing at one boutique that I truly love (I’m picky!), but I manage every time that I visit No.6. It’s on the pricey end, but everything I’ve ever bought here has lasted many years, so well worth the price in the end. Also, a shout-out to the staff, who are always very helpful (my visit today being no exception)—they’re never pushy and give me all the time on my own that I need, yet when I ask them, they always offer excellent opinions and advice. So grateful that this store exists in-person, not just online!
